alert.note: Alert for Geneva (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 16 at 7:47AM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Geneva County in southeastern Alabama, western Jackson, northeastern Bay, northwestern Calhoun, east central Walton, Holmes and Washington Counties in the Panhandle of Florida through 830 AM CDT... At 747 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles east of De Funiak Springs to 9 miles southwest of Vernon. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Vernon, Chipley, Graceville, Bonifay, Slocomb, Bradford, Live Oak, Cottondale, Ponce De Leon, Alford, Caryville, Wausau, Esto, Westville, Ebro, Campbellton, Noma, Black, Moose Pond and Whitehead Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
